name: @sourabh/timeslope
description:
### TimeSlope MCP Server
**Automated Economic analysis via MCP over FRED data**

Plug your agent into FRED and get quick, decision-ready insights. TimeSlope finds the right series and summarizes what matters—no setup details here.

### Tools
- **Plan Research**: Give it a question; get a tight plan with smart follow-ups.
- **Quick Analyze**: Ask about a topic (optionally add dates); get a brief series-backed summary.

### Examples
- “How did unemployment and CPI move from 2018–2024?”
- “Show mortgage rates and home prices during 2008–2012.”
- “Compare US GDP growth and CPI from 2000–2010.”

### Notes
- No forecasting. Not investment advice.

tools.name: get_research_plan
tools.description:
Get a research plan for answering a question.
Always call this tool before calling the execute_step_from_research_plan tool.
Once you have a research plan, you can call the execute_step_from_research_plan tool to answer the question using the research plan that this tool returns.

outputSchema.title: ResearchPlanResponse

research_plan.title: Research Plan
research_plan.description: A research plan for answering the question

qualitative_questions.title: Qualitative Questions
qualitative_questions.description: A list of qualitative questions to ask the research agent. Be extra careful when devising these questions - these should be qualitative questions that can still be somehow gleaned from the quantitative data in FRED time series datasets.

quantitative_questions.title: Quantitative Questions
quantitative_questions.description: A list of quantitative questions to ask the research agent

outputSchema.description: A response that includes a list of questions to ask the research agent to answer the question

tools.name: execute_step_from_research_plan
tools.description:
Query the multiple tools to answer a question about the St. Louis Federal Reserve Economic Database (FRED).
You should use the research plan from the get_research_plan tool before issuing calls to this tool.
Only issue questions to this tool that are the in service of the research plan given by the get_research_plan tool.

SeriesFastSemanticQuery.title: SeriesFastSemanticQuery

query.title: Query
query.description: Semantic description of the of information to search for in the FRED database

observation_end.title: Observation End
observation_end.description: End of observation period (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to latest available. Use this to limit the data to a specific time period, if the question is about a specific time period.

observation_start.title: Observation Start
observation_start.description: Start of observation period (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to earliest available. Use this to limit the data to a specific time period, if the question is about a specific time period.

SeriesFastSemanticQuery.description:
This is a fast version of the SeriesSemanticQuery that is used for the agent.
It is used to search for series that are relevant to the user's question.
Use observation_start and observation_end to limit the data to a specific time period, if the question is about a specific time period.

SeriesDataQuery.title: SeriesDataQuery

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (1-100000)

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of results to skip (non-negative integer)

frequency.description: Frequency aggregation (converts higher to lower frequency)

sort_order.description: Sort order for observations by date

realtime_end.title: Realtime End
realtime_end.description: End of real-time period (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to end of series

vintage_dates.title: Vintage Dates
vintage_dates.description: Comma-separated list of vintage dates (YYYY-MM-DD,YYYY-MM-DD). Avoid using this parameter.

realtime_start.title: Realtime Start
realtime_start.description: Start of real-time period (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to start of series

observation_end.title: Observation End
observation_end.description: End of observation period (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to latest available

observation_start.title: Observation Start
observation_start.description: Start of observation period (YYYY-MM-DD), defaults to earliest available

SeriesDataQuery.description: Query parameters for FRED series observations API

SeriesDataResult.title: SeriesDataResult

value.title: Value
value.description: Observation value (as string to handle '.' for missing values)

realtime_end.title: Realtime End
realtime_end.description: Real-time end date for this observation

realtime_start.title: Realtime Start
realtime_start.description: Real-time start date for this observation

SeriesDataResult.description: Individual observation from FRED series observations API

series_link.title: Series Link
series_link.description: The link to the series on the FRED website. Always cite this link when using the series in your response.

units_short.title: Units Short
units_short.description: The short form of the units of the series

last_updated.title: Last Updated
last_updated.description: The last updated date of the series

realtime_end.title: Realtime End
realtime_end.description: The real-time end date of the series

realtime_start.title: Realtime Start
realtime_start.description: The real-time start date of the series

frequency_short.title: Frequency Short
frequency_short.description: The short form of the frequency of the series

observation_end.title: Observation End
observation_end.description: The end date of the series

group_popularity.title: Group Popularity
group_popularity.description: The group popularity of the series

observation_start.title: Observation Start
observation_start.description: The start date of the series

seasonal_adjustment.title: Seasonal Adjustment
seasonal_adjustment.description: The seasonal adjustment of the series

seasonal_adjustment_short.title: Seasonal Adjustment Short
seasonal_adjustment_short.description: The short form of the seasonal adjustment of the series

SeriesDescriptionResponse.title: SeriesDescriptionResponse

query.description: The query that was used to get the series data

narrative.title: Narrative
narrative.description: A narrative description of the response

max_data_point.description: The maximum data point in the entire series

min_data_point.description: The minimum data point in the entire series

inflection_points.title: Inflection Points
inflection_points.description: The points where the series changes direction

SeriesDescriptionResponse.description: A response that includes a narrative description of a series

outputSchema.title: FastAnalysisResponse

series_data_results.title: Series Data Results
series_data_results.description: A list of relevant queries for relevant FRED series for the given user question

outputSchema.description: A response to a fast analysis query
